heading.taxonomicName: Aplidium lineatum Monniot F. & Monniot C., 1996

subSubSection.paragraph:
Aplidium lineatum Monniot F. & Monniot C., 1996: 137
, fig. 2, pl. 1B. Type locality: Indonesia .

MATERIAL EXAMINED . —
Papua New Guinea .
Milne Bay Province , East Cape, Taodovu reef, 10°21.21’S , 150°56.27’E , 7 m ,
6. VI .1998
( MNHN A1 APL .B 411). — Louisiade Archipelago, Tagula Island, Yuma Pass, 11°22.14’S , 153°20.99’E , 12 m (Sample: CRRF ).

Aplidium longithorax Monniot F., 1987

subSubSection.paragraph:
Aplidium longithorax Monniot F., 1987
( Figs 6 ; 112D )

Aplidium longithorax Monniot F., 1987: 525
, fig. 11c-g, pl. 11F. Type locality: New Caledonia . — Monniot F. & Monniot C. 1996: 139, pl. 1C, Palau .

MATERIAL EXAMINED . —
Papua New Guinea .
Louisiade Archipelago, Calvados Island Chain, Brooker Channel, cave, 11°03.09’S , 152°28.62’E , 20 m ,
1. VI .1998
( MNHN A1 APL .B 417). — Milne Bay Province , East Cape, Boia Boia Waga Island, 10°12.26’S , 150°44.75’E , 22 m ,
27. V .1998
(Sample: CRRF ).

caption.paragraph:
FIG. 7. —
Aplidium macrolobatum Kott, 1992
; A , zooid; B , larva. Scale bars: A, 1 mm; B, 0.5 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: DESCRIPTION
REMARKS
This species is widely distributed in the western Pacific Ocean: New Caledonia , eastern Australia , Papua New Guinea , and Palau .

Aplidium macrolobatum Kott, 1992
( Figs 7 ; 112E )

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Aplidium macrolobatum Kott, 1992a: 561
, fig. 87. Type locality: Queensland .

subSubSection.paragraph:
MATERIAL EXAMINED . —
Philippines .
Bohol Sea, Balicasag Island SW of Bohol , 9°31.02’N , 123°40.83’E , 8 m , 15.IV.1997 ( MNHN A1 APL .B 391).
DESCRIPTION
REMARKS

The characters of this species correspond in all points to Kott’s description (1992a) except that the post-abdomen, when its contains a mature ovary, is as short as the post-abdomen is in the male phase. All stages were found in a same colony.
The distribution of this species in Queensland is now extended to the Philippines .

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Amaroucium nadaense Nishikawa, 1980: 104
. Type locality: Japan .

subSubSection.paragraph:
Aplidium nadaense
– Monniot C. & Monniot F. 1987: 77, Polynesia. — Monniot F. 1987: 530, New Caledonia .

MATERIAL EXAMINED . —
Papua New Guinea .
Louisiade Archipelago, Calvados Island Chain, Brooker Channel, 11°03.09’S , 152°28.62’E , 7 m ,
1. VI .1998
( MNHN A1 APL .B 407). — Louisiade Archipelago, N side Tagula Island, Ima Channel, 11°25.92’S , 153°26.78’E , 7 m ,
1. VI .1998
( MNHN A1 APL .B 408). — Louisiade Archipelago, Tagula Island, Yuma Pass, 11°22. 14’S , 153°20.99’E , 16 m ,
3. VI .1998
(Sample: CRRF ).
DESCRIPTION

caption.paragraph:
FIG. 9. —
Aplidium pictum
n. sp. , two zooids. Scale bar: 1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: REMARKS

This species differs from Nishikawa’s descriptions only in a larger size and 16 rows of stigmata instead of 13 to 15. The others characters correspond well to his original description and also to the specimens from Polynesia and New Caledonia .
